author: arnetheduck
content:
as part of spring cleaning the todo list, I'm thinking of / planning to set up eth-clients/mainnet modelled after eth-clients/sepolia and eth-clients/holesky to replace https://github.com/eth-clients/eth2-networks  which _mostly_ hosts obsolete networks but happens to be the canonical source of bootnodes for eth2 clients - Nimbus for example simply pins a commit in that repo that we bump and ditto for the other networks..

The plan would then be to deprecate / set to read-only archive mode eth2-networks.

Unfortunately, holesky and sepolia don't have a "standardised" directory structure of where the configuration files should go so as part of that move, I'd also seek to normalise the 3 repos so that all have their config/bootnodes/genesis file in a similarly named folder (`config/` maybe) _and_ get rid of bootnodes.txt in the process (relying only on boot-enr.txt only)

If you have thoughts or feedback on this pretty old idea (https://github.com/eth-clients/eth2-networks/issues/84) speak now or forever hold your peace
